page.title: 12LISTED BUILDINGS.
page.content: It is of interest to note that in such a small area of housing there are 18 listed buildings. This means that the homes or remains of homes are of historical interest for various reasons. These buildings can only be used for their original purpose and no external structural alterations can be made to them. A great number of these listed buildings are now only relics, heaps of stones, whose foundations only remain. But a numer of them, originally farms or weavers cottages built on the edge of the moorland, have been renovated and brought up to date inside and are of a high standard of accommodation. Two of the listed buildings are not houses but are the overflow and overflow portal of Butterley Reservoir.
